questions.text: Who was the first king of Israel?
questions.explanation: Saul was anointed by Samuel as the first king of Israel.

questions.text: How many days did God take to create the world?
questions.explanation: God created the world in six days and rested on the seventh.

questions.text: Who built the ark?
questions.explanation: Noah built the ark according to God's instructions to save his family and animals from the flood.

questions.text: What was the name of Abraham's wife?
questions.explanation: Sarah was Abraham's wife and the mother of Isaac.

questions.text: How many plagues did God send upon Egypt?
questions.explanation: God sent ten plagues upon Egypt before Pharaoh let the Israelites go.

questions.text: Who was swallowed by a great fish?
questions.explanation: Jonah was swallowed by a great fish after trying to flee from God's command.

questions.text: Which apostle betrayed Jesus?
questions.explanation: Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus for thirty pieces of silver.

questions.text: Where was Jesus born?
questions.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem, the city of David.

questions.text: How many disciples did Jesus choose?
questions.explanation: Jesus chose twelve disciples to be his apostles.

questions.text: Who wrote the Book of Revelation?
questions.explanation: The apostle John wrote the Book of Revelation while on the island of Patmos.

questions.text: What is the first book of the Bible?
questions.explanation: Genesis is the first book of the Bible and tells of creation and early history.

questions.text: Which Gospel was written by a tax collector?
questions.explanation: Matthew, also called Levi, was a tax collector before following Jesus.

questions.text: In which Gospel do we find the parable of the Good Samaritan?
questions.explanation: The parable of the Good Samaritan is found only in Luke's Gospel.

questions.text: Which Gospel begins with 'In the beginning was the Word'?
questions.explanation: John's Gospel begins with a profound theological statement about Jesus as the Word.

questions.text: Who was the strongest man in the Bible?
questions.explanation: Samson was given supernatural strength by God, which was connected to his uncut hair.

questions.text: Who was thrown into a den of lions?
questions.explanation: Daniel was thrown into the lions' den for praying to God, but was protected by an angel.

questions.text: Who was the mother of Samuel?
questions.explanation: Hannah prayed earnestly for a child and promised to dedicate him to the Lord.

questions.text: Which book contains 'The Lord is my shepherd'?
questions.explanation: Psalm 23, written by David, begins with 'The Lord is my shepherd.'

questions.text: Who wrote most of the Proverbs?
questions.explanation: King Solomon, known for his wisdom, wrote most of the Book of Proverbs.

questions.text: Which prophet was taken up to heaven in a whirlwind?
questions.explanation: Elijah was taken up to heaven in a whirlwind with chariots of fire.

questions.text: Which judge defeated the Midianites with only 300 men?
questions.explanation: God reduced Gideon's army to 300 so Israel could not boast of its own strength.

questions.text: Which Old-Testament book tells of a talking donkey?
questions.explanation: Balaam’s donkey speaks after seeing the angel of the Lord.

questions.text: Who succeeded Moses as leader of Israel?
questions.explanation: Joshua is commissioned to lead the people into Canaan.

questions.text: Which letter of Paul is addressed to a runaway slave’s master?
questions.explanation: Paul pleads with Philemon to receive Onesimus as a brother.

questions.text: In Acts, who is known as the 'son of encouragement'?
questions.explanation: Joseph, a Levite, is nicknamed Barnabas, meaning son of encouragement.

questions.text: Who fell asleep during Paul’s late-night preaching and fell from a window?
questions.explanation: Eutychus survived after Paul embraced him.

questions.text: Which epistle emphasizes 'faith without works is dead'?
questions.explanation: James teaches that genuine faith produces action.

questions.text: Which New-Testament city’s believers were first called 'Christians'?
questions.explanation: Disciples were first called Christians in Antioch of Syria.

questions.text: Which New-Testament book quotes Habakkuk 2:4, 'the righteous shall live by faith'?
questions.explanation: Paul builds his gospel argument on that quotation.

questions.text: Who carried Jesus’ cross part of the way to Golgotha?
questions.explanation: The Synoptic Gospels record Simon being compelled to carry the cross.

questions.text: Which Gospel records Jesus turning water into wine?
questions.explanation: The first sign in John occurs at Cana.

questions.text: Who is the tax collector who climbs a sycamore tree to see Jesus?
questions.explanation: Zacchaeus is mentioned only in Luke’s Gospel.

questions.text: Which Gospel uniquely includes the Parable of the Prodigal Son?
questions.explanation: Luke contains several parables found nowhere else.

questions.text: In Matthew, what does Jesus say are the two greatest commandments?
answers: Keep the Sabbath; Do not steal
questions.explanation: Jesus sums up the Law and Prophets with love of God and neighbour.

questions.text: Which miracle of Jesus is recorded in all four Gospels?
questions.explanation: The feeding of the multitude appears in every Gospel narrative.

questions.text: Who asked Jesus, 'What is truth?'
questions.explanation: Pilate questions Jesus during his trial in John.

questions.text: Which woman became queen of Persia and saved her people?
questions.explanation: Esther risked her life to intercede for the Jews.

questions.text: Who interpreted King Nebuchadnezzar’s dream of a great statue?
questions.explanation: Daniel revealed the statue represented successive kingdoms.

questions.text: Which disciple doubted Jesus’ resurrection until he saw the wounds?
questions.explanation: ‘Doubting’ Thomas exclaimed, “My Lord and my God!”

questions.text: Who hid two Israelite spies on her roof in Jericho?
questions.explanation: Rahab’s faith saved her family when Jericho fell.

questions.text: Who healed Naaman the Syrian of leprosy by telling him to wash in the Jordan?
questions.explanation: Elisha instructed Naaman to dip seven times.

questions.text: Which psalm opens with 'Blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked'?
questions.explanation: Psalm 1 contrasts the righteous and the wicked.

questions.text: According to Proverbs, what is 'a gentle answer' said to do?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:1 contrasts gentle and harsh words.

questions.text: Which prophet saw a vision of a valley of dry bones?
questions.explanation: Ezekiel’s vision symbolized Israel's restoration.

questions.text: Which Old-Testament book concludes, 'Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God and keep His commandments'?
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes ends by summarizing the duty of humanity.

questions.text: Which wisdom book personifies Wisdom as calling out in the streets?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 1 depicts Wisdom shouting in public places.
